author: Parvathi Menon
text:
The British government has appointed Sir Dominic Asquith as the next High Commissioner to India. He will replace Sir James Bevan. Starting as a freelance journalist in Amman in the early 1980s, Sir Dominic joined the British diplomatic service in 1983. He survived a rocket-propelled grenade attack on his convoy in June 2012 in Benghazi, Libya.

Sir Dominic will take up his assignment later this month.
title: Dominic Asquith is British High Commissioner
